title: Biannual postmarket safety reports on lecanemab

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

November 12, 2024
Food and Drug Administration
Division of Freedom of Information (HFI-35)

RE: Expedited Freedom of Information Act request

Dear FOIA Officer:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552a, and under FDA’s expedited processing regulation 21 CFR § 20.44, I am requesting copies of the postmarket biannual safety reports that the FDA requested of Eisai (Biogen as cooperating company) to include data on ARIA,, brain hemorrhages and death of lecanemab patients (application 761269Orig1s000).  

I previously requested more extensive records as follows: "...all meeting records/minutes/notes documenting interactions between agency staff and Esai inc. or Biogen personnel regarding the drug, lecanemab (Leqembi) from December 1, 2023 through the present November 3, 2024 related to the following search terms: "deaths" "died" "mortality" "death rate". This should include any references to journalists reporting on Leqembi by FDA agency staff whether or not the communication includes an employee of Eisai or Biogen."  

Since my prior request is far more detailed, I'm asking for the biannual reports  separately as I believe this could be more rapidly fulfilled via an expedited request since the safety of lecanemab and associated deaths are currently a significant source of concern among many researchers and the press . I am therefore requesting expedited handling of this limited request. 

I am a professional journalist writing for The BMJ. 
 
As an investigative journalist, I request a waiver of fees associated with processing this FOIA request and duplicating responsive records.  

Thank you for your attention to this request.

Sincerely,


Jeanne Lenzer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jeanne Lenzer

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Dakota Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Emails between the office of Gov. Kristi Noem and any email address ending in mfa.gov.il, chicago.mfa.gov.il, aipac.org, aipacpac.org, israeliamerican.org, iacforaction.org, and/or standwithus.com between 7 October 2023 and the date this request is processed.

If the emails contain attachments, please include those attachments as well.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti
